text: Thanks <@U01NRM1BS3A>! I had not done one of those rollups before. That's exactly what I was looking for! I can definitely get the count using that. It'll be perfect. Thank you!

Interestingly, it looks like the rollup properties don't directly trigger `onCrmPropertiesUpdate` to run. However, whenever I change the value of another property, the rollup value displays its updated value. So I'll have to figure out another way to trigger the change. But I think it's a step in the right direction!
Agreed. Writing up all the “Add CRM Card” steps in the user guide, is “friction, not delight”

Do CRM action components provide for callbacks? The buttons are great, but I want the extension to trigger another action once the first is done. For instance, I want to add a new custom object, and then display the number of associated custom objects in the card (very simplified example).

<@U01NRM1BS3A> suggested using a rollup property to increment the number of associated objects, however, it looks like `onCrmPropertiesUpdate` isn't getting triggered by a change to the rollup property.
